greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of even divisors of sigma(n).
comment: sigma(n) = sum of divisors of n, A000203.
link: Charles R Greathouse IV, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
example: a(14) = 6 because sigma(14) = 24 and the 6 even divisors are {2, 4, 6, 8, 12, 24}.
mathematica: f[n_] := Block[{d = Divisors[DivisorSigma[1,n]]}, Count[EvenQ[d], True]]; Table[f[n], {n, 80}]
results.author: _Michel Lagneau_, Jul 23 2011
